title: Julius Caesar fights Titus Labienus in the Battle of Ruspina.
text: • 46 BC – Julius Caesar fights Titus Labienus in the Battle of Ruspina.

title: Battle of Reading: Æthelred of Wessex fights, and is defeated by, a Danish invasion army.
text: • 871 – Battle of Reading: Æthelred of Wessex fights, and is defeated by, a Danish invasion army.

title: Anne of Brittany announces that all those who would ally with the King of France will be considered guilty of the crime of lèse
text: • 1490 – Anne of Brittany announces that all those who would ally with the King of France will be considered guilty of the crime of lèse-majesté.

title: King Charles I of England attempts to arrest Five Members of Parliament, commencing England's slide into civil war.
text: • 1642 – King Charles I of England attempts to arrest Five Members of Parliament, commencing England's slide into civil war.

title: English Civil War: The Rump Parliament votes to put Charles I on trial.
text: • 1649 – English Civil War: The Rump Parliament votes to put Charles I on trial.

title: The Netherlands, Great Britain, and France sign the Triple Alliance in an attempt to maintain the Treaty of Utrecht , Britain having signed a preliminary alliance with France on November 28 (November 17, 1716).
text: • 1717 – The Netherlands, Great Britain, and France sign the Triple Alliance in an attempt to maintain the Treaty of Utrecht , Britain having signed a preliminary alliance with France on November 28 (November 17, 1716).

title: Great Britain enters the Seven Years' War against Spain and Naples.
text: • 1762 – Great Britain enters the Seven Years' War against Spain and Naples.

title: Constantine Hangerli arrives in Bucharest, Wallachia, as its new Prince, invested by the Ottoman Empire.
text: • 1798 – Constantine Hangerli arrives in Bucharest, Wallachia, as its new Prince, invested by the Ottoman Empire.

title: Samuel Colt sells his first revolver pistol to the United States government.
text: • 1847 – Samuel Colt sells his first revolver pistol to the United States government.

title: After having been kidnapped and sold into slavery in the American South, Solomon Northup regains his freedom; his memoir Twelve Years a Slave later becomes a national bestseller.
text: • 1853 – After having been kidnapped and sold into slavery in the American South, Solomon Northup regains his freedom; his memoir Twelve Years a Slave later becomes a national bestseller.

title: The McDonald Islands are discovered by Captain William McDonald aboard the Samarang.
text: • 1854 – The McDonald Islands are discovered by Captain William McDonald aboard the Samarang.

title: The New Apostolic Church, a Christian and chiliastic church, is established in Hamburg, Germany.
text: • 1863 – The New Apostolic Church, a Christian and chiliastic church, is established in Hamburg, Germany.

title: The New York Stock Exchange opens its first permanent headquarters near Wall Street in New York City.
text: • 1865 – The New York Stock Exchange opens its first permanent headquarters near Wall Street in New York City.

title: Russo
text: • 1878 – Russo-Turkish War (1877–78): Sofia is liberated from Ottoman rule and becomes capital of Liberated Bulgaria in 1879.

title: The Fabian Society is founded in London, England, United Kingdom.
text: • 1884 – The Fabian Society is founded in London, England, United Kingdom.

title: Utah is admitted as the 45th U.S. state.
text: • 1896 – Utah is admitted as the 45th U.S. state.

title: Topsy, an elephant, is electrocuted by the owners of Luna Park, Coney Island. The Edison film company shoots the film Electrocuting an Elephant of Topsy's death.
text: • 1903 – Topsy, an elephant, is electrocuted by the owners of Luna Park, Coney Island. The Edison film company shoots the film Electrocuting an Elephant of Topsy's death.

title: The Scout Association is incorporated throughout the British Empire by royal charter.
text: • 1912 – The Scout Association is incorporated throughout the British Empire by royal charter.

title: The Finnish Declaration of Independence is recognized by Russia, Sweden, Germany and France.
text: • 1918 – The Finnish Declaration of Independence is recognized by Russia, Sweden, Germany and France.

title: World War II: Operation Carpetbagger, involving the dropping of arms and supplies to resistance fighters in Europe, begins.
text: • 1944 – World War II: Operation Carpetbagger, involving the dropping of arms and supplies to resistance fighters in Europe, begins.

title: Burma gains its independence from the United Kingdom becoming an independent republic, named the Union of Burma, with Sao Shwe Thaik as its first President and U Nu its first Prime Minister.
text: • 1948 – Burma gains its independence from the United Kingdom becoming an independent republic, named the Union of Burma, with Sao Shwe Thaik as its first President and U Nu its first Prime Minister.

title: Korean War: Chinese and North Korean forces capture Seoul.
text: • 1951 – Korean War: Chinese and North Korean forces capture Seoul.

title: The Greek National Radical Union is formed by Konstantinos Karamanlis.
text: • 1955 – The Greek National Radical Union is formed by Konstantinos Karamanlis.

title: Sputnik 1 falls to Earth from orbit.
text: • 1958 – Sputnik 1 falls to Earth from orbit.

title: Luna 1 becomes the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.
text: • 1959 – Luna 1 becomes the first spacecraft to reach the vicinity of the Moon.

title: Gypsy opened and closed on Broadway after 120 performances and four previews
text: • 1959 – Gypsy opened and closed on Broadway after 120 performances and four previews

title: A military coup takes place in Upper Volta (later Burkina Faso), dissolving the National Parliament and leading to a new national constitution.
text: • 1966 – A military coup takes place in Upper Volta (later Burkina Faso), dissolving the National Parliament and leading to a new national constitution.

title: Rose Heilbron becomes the first female judge to sit at the Old Bailey in London, England.
text: • 1972 – Rose Heilbron becomes the first female judge to sit at the Old Bailey in London, England.

title: United States President Richard Nixon refuses to hand over materials subpoenaed by the Senate Watergate Committee.
text: • 1974 – United States President Richard Nixon refuses to hand over materials subpoenaed by the Senate Watergate Committee.

title: The Troubles: The Ulster Volunteer Force shoots dead six Irish Catholic civilians in County Armagh, Northern Ireland. The next day, gunmen shoot dead ten Protestant civilians nearby in retaliation.
text: • 1976 – The Troubles: The Ulster Volunteer Force shoots dead six Irish Catholic civilians in County Armagh, Northern Ireland. The next day, gunmen shoot dead ten Protestant civilians nearby in retaliation.

title: The Maryland train collision: An Amtrak train en route to Boston from Washington, D.C., collides with Conrail engines in Chase, Maryland, killing 16 people.
text: • 1987 – The Maryland train collision: An Amtrak train en route to Boston from Washington, D.C., collides with Conrail engines in Chase, Maryland, killing 16 people.

title: Second Gulf of Sidra incident: A pair of Libyan MiG
text: • 1989 – Second Gulf of Sidra incident: A pair of Libyan MiG-23 "Floggers" are shot down by a pair of US Navy F-14 Tomcats during an air-to-air confrontation.

title: In Pakistan's deadliest train accident an overloaded passenger train collides with an empty freight train, resulting in 307 deaths and 700 injuries.
text: • 1990 – In Pakistan's deadliest train accident an overloaded passenger train collides with an empty freight train, resulting in 307 deaths and 700 injuries.

title: Wilaya of Relizane massacres in Algeria: Over 170 are killed in three remote villages.
text: • 1998 – Wilaya of Relizane massacres in Algeria: Over 170 are killed in three remote villages.

title: A massive ice storm hits eastern Canada and the northeastern United States, continuing through January 10 and causing widespread destruction.
text: • 1998 – A massive ice storm hits eastern Canada and the northeastern United States, continuing through January 10 and causing widespread destruction.

title: Former professional wrestler Jesse Ventura is sworn in as governor of Minnesota.
text: • 1999 – Former professional wrestler Jesse Ventura is sworn in as governor of Minnesota.

title: Spirit, a NASA Mars rover, lands successfully on Mars at 04:35 UTC.
text: • 2004 – Spirit, a NASA Mars rover, lands successfully on Mars at 04:35 UTC.

title: Mikheil Saakashvili is elected President of Georgia following the November 2003 Rose Revolution.
text: • 2004 – Mikheil Saakashvili is elected President of Georgia following the November 2003 Rose Revolution.

title: Prime Minister Ariel Sharon of Israel suffers a second, apparently more serious stroke. His authority is transferred to acting Prime Minister Ehud Olmert.
text: • 2006 – Prime Minister Ariel Sharon of Israel suffers a second, apparently more serious stroke. His authority is transferred to acting Prime Minister Ehud Olmert.

title: The 110th United States Congress convenes, electing Nancy Pelosi as the first female Speaker of the House in U.S. history.
text: • 2007 – The 110th United States Congress convenes, electing Nancy Pelosi as the first female Speaker of the House in U.S. history.

title: The Burj Khalifa, the current tallest building in the world, officially opens in Dubai.
text: • 2010 – The Burj Khalifa, the current tallest building in the world, officially opens in Dubai.

title: A gunman kills eight people in a house
text: • 2013 – A gunman kills eight people in a house-to-house rampage in Kawit, Cavite, Philippines.

title: A passenger train operated by Shosholoza Meyl collided with a truck on a level crossing at Geneva Station between Hennenman and Kroonstad, Free State, South Africa. Twenty people were killed and 260 were injured.
text: • 2018 – A passenger train operated by Shosholoza Meyl collided with a truck on a level crossing at Geneva Station between Hennenman and Kroonstad, Free State, South Africa. Twenty people were killed and 260 were injured.
